Name: Alan Aldous
Notes: Headmaster of Leeds Grammar School ( 1970-1975 )

Name: Edward Barnwell
Notes: Headmaster of Ruthin School ( 1839-1865 ) , succeeding Charles Williams

Name: Edmund Brice
Notes: Translator and schoolmaster , and follower of the Christian mystic John Pordage

Name: John Caldicott
Degree: BA Literae Humaniores ( 2nd , 1851 ) , BA Mathematics ( 3rd , 1851 ) , BD and DD ( 1874 )
Notes: Matriculated from Pembroke College ; Anglican priest and headmaster of Bristol Grammar School

Name: J. R. Cohu ( F )
Notes: Headmaster , clergyman and writer on biblical topics

Name: William Weekes Fowler
Notes: Matriculated at New College before transferring to Jesus with a scholarship ; a clergyman , headmaster ( of Lincoln School ) and entomologist who was President of the Incorporated Association of Head Masters and President of the Entomological Society of London

Name: Daniel Harper ( F/P )
Notes: Headmaster of Cowbridge Grammar School ( 1847-1850 ) and Sherborne School ( 1851-1877 )

Name: John Haycraft
Notes: English language teacher and founder of International House World Organisation

Name: Herbert Armitage James
Notes: Transferred to Lincoln College when he won a scholarship in 1864 ; later headmaster of Rugby School and President of St John 's College , Oxford

Name: Robert James
Notes: Son of Henry James , Dean of Bangor ; High Master of St Paul 's School ( 1946-1953 ) and Headmaster of Harrow School ( 1953-1971 )

Name: Harold Littler
Notes: Anglican priest and headmaster of Sir William Turner 's School , Coatham

Name: Daniel Lewis Lloyd
Notes: Headmaster of Dolgelley Grammar School , Friars School , Bangor and Christ College , Brecon ; later Bishop of Bangor

Name: Edward Owen
Notes: Welsh priest and translator , who was headmaster of the grammar school in Warrington

Name: Owen Owen
Notes: Headmaster in Oswestry who became the first Chief Inspector of the Central Welsh Board for Intermediate Education

Name: Morgan Phillips
Notes: Headmaster of Ruthin School ( 1930-1935 )

Name: Owen Price
Notes: Graduated from Christ Church , Oxford ; Master of Magdalen College School , Oxford and writer of educational books

Name: Ernest Salter Davies
Notes: Director of Education for Kent for 20 years and writer on educational matters

Name: Thomas Thomas
Notes: Welsh cleric ( Thomas of Caernarfon ) who helped to found schools in Caernarfon ; the father of Llewellyn Thomas

Name: James Vincent
Notes: Welsh cleric and schoolteacher , who was Master of the Friars School , Bangor ; grandfather of James Vincent , who also attended the college

Name: Charles Williams ( F/P )
Notes: Headmaster of Ruthin School ( 1831-1839 ) , Principal ( 1857-1877 )
